examples: When the cibolero returned to the plain, he was received with a fresh burst of vivas, and kerchiefs were waved to greet him.

verbs.description: viva (third-person singular simple present vivas, present participle vivaing, simple past and past participle vivaed)

examples: ...the people clapped and vivaed, groaned and hooted, as they were pleased or disappointed, until at length the intense excitement began to subside...

description: Shortened from viva voce, Latin for “live voice”

entries.meaning: An oral examination, typically for an academic qualification.

verbs.description: viva (third-person singular simple present vivas, present participle vivaing, simple past and past participle vivaed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To subject to an examination of this kind.
examples: Throughout his life, he took college responsibilities seriously, he came to All Souls whenever possible on weekends, he vivaed or interviewed candidates...
